title: Samaritan Pentateuch
summary: The Samaritan Pentateuch, also known as the Samaritan Torah (Hebrew: תורה שומרונית‎ torah shomronit), is a text of the first five books of the Hebrew Bible, written in the Samaritan script and used as sacred scripture by the Samaritans.[1] It dates back to one of the ancient versions of the Hebrew Bible that existed during the Second Temple period, and constitutes their entire biblical canon.[1]
